title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted water according to package instructions.
Fry the pancetta in a pan until crispy.
Whisk the eggs with Parmesan cheese and black pepper.
Combine the pasta with the pancetta and toss with the egg mixture.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate the chicken in yogurt and tikka masala paste for 1 hour.
Grill the chicken until cooked through.
Cook the onions and add the tikka paste and coconut milk.
Add the chicken and cook until the sauce thickens.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
summary: A colorful and healthy mix of stir-fried vegetables with soy sauce and spices.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and ginger, and stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the bell peppers, carrot, zucchini, broccoli, and snap peas to the pan. Stir-fry for about 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and rice vinegar.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat.
Cook for another 2-3 minutes, allowing the sauce to thicken slightly.
Remove from heat and sprinkle sesame seeds on top if desired.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Soft tacos filled with seasoned beef, fresh lettuce, cheese, and salsa.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic, and sauté until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add the ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it apart with a spoon as it cooks.
Once the beef is browned, drain excess fat and add taco seasoning and water. Stir to combine.
Simmer the mixture for 5-7 minutes until the sauce thickens and is well combined.
While the beef is simmering, warm the taco tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave.
To assemble the tacos, spoon the beef mixture onto each tortilla.
Top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, diced red onion, shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, salsa, and sliced jalapeños.
Serve with lime wedges for squeezing over the tacos.
